org.kiji.schema
Interface AtomicKijiPutter

All Superinterfaces:
Closeable
All Known Implementing Classes:
HBaseAtomicKijiPutter
@ApiAudience.Public
@ApiStability.Experimental
@Inheritance.Sealed
public interface AtomicKijiPutter
extends Closeable

Interface for performing atomic puts to a single row of a Kiji table.

Usage example: 

   KijiTable table = ...
   AtomicKijiPutter putter = table.getWriterFactory().openAtomicWriter();
   try {
     // Begin an atomic write transaction on the specified row:
     putter.begin(entityId);

     // Accumulate a set of puts to write atomically:
     putter.put(family, qualifier, "value");
     // More puts...

     // Write all puts atomically:
     putter.commit();
   } finally {
     putter.close();
   }

            throws IOException

IOException - in case of an error.

checkAndCommit

<T> boolean checkAndCommit(String family,
                           String qualifier,
                           T value)
                       throws IOException
Atomically tests the content of a cell for a specific value, and performs the accumulated puts if the test succeeds.

  • If the passed value is null, the check is for the lack of a cell (i.e. non-existance).
  • If the check fails, the current transaction remains open and unmodified. It is up to the caller to retry or rollback.
  • If the commit succeeds, the current transaction is completed and a new transaction may start with begin().

    Type Parameters:
    T - Type of the data to be checked.
    Parameters:
    family - Column Family of the cell to check.
    qualifier - Column Qualifier of the cell to check.
    value - Data in the cell to check.
    Returns:
    Whether the check passed and Put executed.
    Throws:
    IOException - in case of an error.

    • rollback

    void rollback()
    Discards the current transaction.

    The current transaction is aborted, the accumulated puts are lost. No calls to put(), commit() or checkAndCommit() are allowed until a new transaction may start with begin().

    put

    <T> void put(String family,
             String qualifier,
             T value)
         throws IOException
    Stages a put to be written.

    Requires a current transaction started using begin().

    Type Parameters:
    T - Type of the data to be written.
    Parameters:
    family - Column Family of the target cell.
    qualifier - Column Qualifier of the target cell.
    value - Data for the target cell.
    Throws:
    IOException - in case of an error.

    put
